Trackball.cpp

Contains the methods used to implement the CTrackball object.

Functions
CreateTrackball
CAUSTICAPI CRefObj<ITrackball> CreateTrackball()

Global function for creating a track ball. This method should generally not be called. Use the ICausticFactory to create new Caustic objects.

Returns

Returns the newly created trackball.

ComputeSurfacePosition
void CTrackball::ComputeSurfacePosition(
int screenX,
int screenY,
Vector3 *pPos
)

Converts a screen coordinate into a point on our trackball surface

Parameters
screenX
int

X position of mouse in screen coordinates

screenY
int

Y position of mouse in screen coordinates

pPos
Vector3*

Returns the position of the screen coordinate on the trackball surface

int screenX,
int screenY,
int screenW,
int screenH
)

Called at start of mouse drag

Parameters
screenX
int

X position of mouse in screen coordinates

screenY
int

Y position of mouse in screen coordinates

screenW
int

Width of screen in pixels

screenH
int

Height of screen in pixels

UpdateTracking
bool CTrackball::UpdateTracking(
int screenX,
int screenY,
ETrackballConstraint constraint,
DirectX::XMMATRIX *pMatrix
)

Called each time mouse is moved

Parameters
constraint
ETrackballConstraint

Constrain rotation to be about specific axis

X position of mouse in screen coordinates

int

Y position of mouse in screen coordinates

EndTracking
void CTrackball::EndTracking()

Called at end of mouse drag
